channel.title: Carrying on from the previous
channel.description:
Sorry I wanted to add something to my other recent topic about an offline server, but I thought I'd repeat the question here just in case nobody saw the update to that topic's last post.
Three more questions:
1) At the moment, if I go through the gates to Al Kharid from Lumbridge, I just go through, no dialogue. Is there a way of adding the text concerning paying 10 coins to pass? Is there also a way to pay 10 coins?
2) How do you adjust the xp you receive for different monsters?
3) Is it ok to just edit an xml inside a gz archive, e.g. for shops.xml instead of using a compression tool? If it's not okay, could someone provide a link/directions to a compression tool?
Thanks!

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Alas alas.

I’ve attached two more pictures of the results. I only managed to printscreen some of the compile process before the window closed, hopefully it’s got all the info you need.

Anyway time for bed, I’ll check back in tomorrow.

In terms of the line saying ‘Java.exe not found’ during the compile process, I found another thread online which said that removing taskkill /F /IM java.exe from the code made a difference. I did that but I still got the same error when trying to run the client after compiling.

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Yes you need to change it to yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Now before I do that, when I open up compile.bat in notepad, this is the text:

taskkill /F /IM java.exe
set PATH=%PATH%;ant\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11
ant compile

The Java I have on the machine I’m using is 6v35, so does the mention of 11 need removing and replacing with 35?

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

run the compile.bat make sure it runs without errors.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:

Ok so I see a compile.bat in the client folder, that the one?

I can’t see a client.jar file, is it supposed to be in the client folder?

item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

Okay then. Gawdz?

Lmfao @ this forum. Sorry only visit these forums on the weekdays.

When you changed those colors did you recompile and pack the client.jar file?

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Thanks Rodger, I shall examine menu.java and miscpacketbuilder.java carefully for the lines.

Ok so I found blue colour codes in menu.java, and changed them to grey ones.

public class Menu {
public static final int COLOUR_BOX_GRADIENT_TOP = 0x666666;
public static final int COLOUR_BOX_GRADIENT_BOTTOM = 0x999999;
public static final int COLOUR_BOX_BORDER1 = 0x999999;
public static final int COLOUR_BOX_BORDER2 = 0x666666;

But when I loaded up the client, the boxes were still blue. Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Ok so is that in terms of changing the colour of the boxes or changing the server messages?

Use notepad++ or an IDE (such as eclipse) for reading, writing, editing code.

Yes colors of boxes have a color code in menu.java

Server messages are sent from the server. So you will need to look at which file it relates too. MiscPacketBuilder.java

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Okay then. Gawdz?

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

open mudclient class. search “gameGraphics.drawString(” or there should be a hotkey to remove it (f5 f6 f7?)

Explore the directory and learn what is in each file. It’s all in there except for things sent from the server (your welcome message)

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Alas I can’t quite see whereabouts that string of text is. Are we talking about the menu.java found in NOOBscape v3\Client\src\org\rscdaemon\client ? When I search for, say, ‘gcn’ or ‘rgbToIntMod’ in that menu.java, it returns nothing. By the way, do you think this change will also correct the colour for the loading bar?

Whilst you’re working that one out some more queries.

j) As per the attached Welcome.jpg and Welcome2.jpg, I’ve managed change things so at the bottom left, after logging in, it will say ‘Welcome to Runescape’. However, the login popup at the centre of the screen, as u can see still mentions NOOBscape. In a similar vein I hope, how do I remove the Powered by and Online players messages, shown in from Welcome2.jpg?

k) In terms of the server messages, I managed to remove the actual announcements but how do I remove the ‘[Server Message]’ text, as seen in Leftside messages.jpg, without breaking the server? When I tried to clear the advert file completely the server didn’t like that at all; and I saw no mention of the text ‘[Server Message]’ in that file either.

l) Also seen in Leftside messages.jpg, there is text to the left of the character, such as Exp gained and Fight mode. How do I remove all that?

m) As per you guys’ instructions I’ve managed to change the stats of npcs, in terms of hp/str etc and I’ve also managed to change the xp rate from 5x to 1x. But what factors determine xp yield? Does it go off the npc’s combat level, or hits, or a combination or something else?

n) I’ve managed to, just as an experiment, add a lesser demon in Lumby castle courtyard. But is it possible to have, say, a lvl 79 lesser, alongside a lvl 85, alongside a lvl 90, or does one npc id have to stick with the same stats globally?

o) Not too bothered about this one, more out of curiosity really The popup says I logged in 55205 days ago, how did it come to that conclusion?

p)A slightly different question which maybe can’t be solved but here goes. In the actual title of the client window, just to the right of the java coffee icon, the heading is NOOBscape; can that be changed?

My deepest thanks again. I think I’m nearly there, after these issues are sorted, all that should be left is for me to go in and take a bit of time to make sure all shops have the right items and maybe slightly increase gold drops for all monsters to make combat a bit more of a viable moneymaking technique.

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“mft004, post:6, topic:552032”]Sorry Gawdz I need help again

So attached is what I’ve managed so far with changing the login screen and loading screen.

But is there a way to change the colour of the click boxes e.g. the ‘Click here to log in’ button? They were grey according to memory, getting used to that blue shade would be very difficult for me.
And is there a way to get rid of the ‘Welcome to Noobscape’ etc, maybe replace it with ‘Welcome to Runescape Classic’?
Oh and another thing Any chance of making the title of the actual window ‘Runescape’ rather than ‘NOOBscape’?

My thanks again.[/quote]
Their color can be changed from Menu class. Look for these in constructor

github.com

xetr0v/mpc-client/blob/master/src/org/moparscape/msc/client/Menu.java#L35

    

  1.     componentHeight = new int[i];

    2. 

  2.     copmonentInputMaxLength = new int[i];

    3. 

  3.     componentTextSize = new int[i];

    4. 

  4.     componentText = new String[i];

    5. 

  5.     componentTextList = new String[i][];

    6. 

  6.     scrollBarGradientColorTop = rgbToIntMod(114, 114, 176);

    7. 

  7.     scrollBarGradientColorBottom = rgbToIntMod(14, 14, 62);

    8. 

  8.     scrollBarDraggingBarLine1Color = rgbToIntMod(200, 208, 232);

    9. 

  9.     scrollBarDraggingBarColor = rgbToIntMod(96, 129, 184);

    10. 

  10.     scrollBarDraggingBarLine2Color = rgbToIntMod(53, 95, 115);

    11. 

  11.     gcn = rgbToIntMod(117, 142, 171);

    12. 

  12.     gda = rgbToIntMod(98, 122, 158);

    13. 

  13.     gdb = rgbToIntMod(86, 100, 136);

    14. 

  14.     gdc = rgbToIntMod(135, 146, 179);

    15. 

  15.     gdd = rgbToIntMod(97, 112, 151);

    16. 

  16.     gde = rgbToIntMod(88, 102, 136);

    17. 

  17.     gdf = rgbToIntMod(84, 93, 120);

    18. 

  18. }

    19. 

  19. 

    20. 

  20. public int rgbToIntMod(int i, int k, int l) {

    21. 

  21.     return GameImage.rgbToInt((redMod * i) / 114, (greenMod * k) / 114, (blueMod * l) / 176);

    22.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Sorry Gawdz I need help again

So attached is what I’ve managed so far with changing the login screen and loading screen.

But is there a way to change the colour of the click boxes e.g. the ‘Click here to log in’ button? They were grey according to memory, getting used to that blue shade would be very difficult for me.
And is there a way to get rid of the ‘Welcome to Noobscape’ etc, maybe replace it with ‘Welcome to Runescape Classic’?
Oh and another thing Any chance of making the title of the actual window ‘Runescape’ rather than ‘NOOBscape’?

My thanks again.

Read full topic

item.title: Carrying on from the previous
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“mft004, post:1, topic:552032”]Sorry I wanted to add something to my other recent topic about an offline server, but I thought I’d repeat the question here just in case nobody saw the update to that topic’s last post.

Three more questions:

  1. At the moment, if I go through the gates to Al Kharid from Lumbridge, I just go through, no dialogue. Is there a way of adding the text concerning paying 10 coins to pass? Is there also a way to pay 10 coins?

  2. How do you adjust the xp you receive for different monsters?

  3. Is it ok to just edit an xml inside a gz archive, e.g. for shops.xml instead of using a compression tool? If it’s not okay, could someone provide a link/directions to a compression tool?

Thanks![/quote]

  1. yes when you do the object action event just check either the coords or if you have a specific object id for this gate you could use that then once inside that if statement just do a quick check for the players inventory amount of coins open up a question menu stating they can either pay 10 gp or gtfo. If they decided to pay check to see if the player still has 10 coins and then remove 10 coins their inventory.

2)There should be exp in the npcdef you can either mess with the base exp or add a multiplier to the game handler.

  1. You can compress with 7zip.

Read full topic
